text:
I have a default Fedora 5 Apache installation:

Server version: Apache/2.2.2
Server built:   Jun  7 2006 07:01:44
Server's Module Magic Number: 20051115:2
Server loaded:  APR 1.2.7, APR-Util 1.2.7
Compiled using: APR 1.2.7, APR-Util 1.2.7
Architecture:   32-bit
Server MPM:     Prefork
  threaded:     no
    forked:     yes (variable process count)
Server compiled with....
 -D APACHE_MPM_DIR="server/mpm/prefork"
 -D APR_HAS_SENDFILE
 -D APR_HAS_MMAP
 -D APR_HAVE_IPV6 (IPv4-mapped addresses enabled)
 -D APR_USE_SYSVSEM_SERIALIZE
 -D APR_USE_PTHREAD_SERIALIZE
 -D SINGLE_LISTEN_UNSERIALIZED_ACCEPT
 -D APR_HAS_OTHER_CHILD
 -D AP_HAVE_RELIABLE_PIPED_LOGS
 -D DYNAMIC_MODULE_LIMIT=128
 -D HTTPD_ROOT="/etc/httpd"
 -D SUEXEC_BIN="/usr/sbin/suexec"
 -D DEFAULT_PIDLOG="logs/httpd.pid"
 -D DEFAULT_SCOREBOARD="logs/apache_runtime_status"
 -D DEFAULT_LOCKFILE="logs/accept.lock"
 -D DEFAULT_ERRORLOG="logs/error_log"
 -D AP_TYPES_CONFIG_FILE="conf/mime.types"
 -D SERVER_CONFIG_FILE="conf/httpd.conf"

with PHP installed as a module: 

 LoadModule php5_module modules/libphp5.so
 AddHandler php5-script .php
 AddType text/html .php

the problem is that files named like "org.eclipse.php.core_0.1.4.jar" are 
interpreted as PHP files, and therefore responsibility for handling this file 
is passed to the PHP interpreter.

I've tried to add "AddType application/java-archive jar" to the httpd.conf, but
this doesn't solve the problem.

Thanks!
creator: spektom@gmail.com

text:
Created attachment 18653
My Apache config files.
creator: spektom@gmail.com

text:
Use e.g. "AddHandler default .jar" to prevent this; this is how mod_mime works,
see:  http://httpd.apache.org/docs/2.2/mod/mod_mime.html#page-header
creator: jorton@redhat.com
rpluem@apache.org
text:
Other possibility:

Use

AddType application/x-httpd-php .php

instead of 

AddHandler php5-script .php
